result.execSummary:
The defendant Carmen K. Schollmeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Rock County Ordinance - Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carmen K. Schollmeyer

records.addlTxt: 1:51 PM Defendant Carmen K. Schollmeyer not in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz appeared by video for Carmen K. Schollmeyer.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint to forfeiture filed. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant guilty and orders $392.50.

Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
